intro: Nectandra mollis var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy nectandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its bark and leaves contain essential oils, which have been used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and possibly medicinal properties. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological research.
